intro: Cuchumatanea steyermarkii, commonly known as the Guiana Shield cuchumatanea, is a rare and endemic species found in the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its seeds are enclosed in woody capsules, and it plays a role in the ecological balance of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a vulnerable species.
